author: potuz
content: Why is this an EIP if the ssz spec is in consensus?

author: etan_status
content: Just to have everything in one place. Plus, it's not possible to refer to PRs from EIPs.

author: potuz
content: It would be very weird to have specified some parts of SSZ in the CL specs and some others in an EIP, will you move all of the previous ssz spec to the EIP repo then?

author: etan_status
content:
No, EIPs are allowed to link to CL specs. So, once we agree on an approach for representing transactions/receipts, I will open a matching PR to the SSZ specs in CL repo, and also extend the `remerkleable` implementation and provide tests. Until that agreement is reached, I think it's easier to have all the ideas in one place.

Likewise, EIP-4895 also defines some ideas that affect CL specs. The approach was similar, first to create the EIP with the idea, then materialize a matching spec in CL repo and extend with tests.

author: etan_status
content: It's just open PRs that can't be linked (there is a validator during CI that checks all the links)

author: etan_status
content: Your concern is only about the 7495, right?

author: etan_status
content: Have put this concern here as well, ultimately it is something that affects both consensus and execution, so having the specs of the SSZ extension in both places is probably alright. https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-7495-ssz-partialcontainer/15476/5

author: etan_status
content:
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/7509/files
You can see here, in 6493 I'd like to refer to the `PartialContainer`. It can't be referenced until it exists somewhere (either as a draft EIP, or as a merged consensus-specs PR). For consensus-specs PRs, it seems they only get merged once people are sure that they want them. While for EIPs, it is common for them to describe an idea that is still under discussion. Anyway, if a maintainer has a strong preference, I'm fine moving it wherever they want. Until then, I guess leaving it in the EIPs repo is alright.
